speaker: Hollow City
line: The air tastes like old iron and cold parchment. Above, towers lean inward as if listening to secrets traded in the streets below.

speaker: Hollow Guard
line: Undercity threshold. State purpose. Speak clearly—echoes carry names here.

speaker: Hollow Guard
line: Then don’t look surprised when the city answers back.

choices.text: Blend in with the Marked crowd.

speaker: Street Hawker
line: Masks! Papers! Seals that look official from ten paces! Two paces if you squint!

speaker: Archivist Noma
line: You’re not from here. Your questions have edges. If you want the city’s truth, start with its lies—learn who profits from them.

speaker: Archivist Noma
line: Begin with names that repeat. The Herald. The King. The clauses no one admits they signed. And the quiet folk who carry messages between them.

speaker: Hollow City
line: Somewhere deeper, a bell chimes once—too soft to be heard, too precise to be imagined.
